node.title: EPL players will undergo daily COVID tests to avoid league shutdown
node.description: Premier League players and staff will now receive daily COVID-19 tests and follow stricter social distancing and mask rules as the Omicron variant surges in England.

node.title: It's 'here they come, ready or not' for Tasmania as border opens
node.description: After almost two years of living the hermit life, Tasmania is open again to visitors and returning locals, but whether residents of the island state are ready or not for COVID-19 is another matter entirely.

node.title: SNAs great if you have the space: West Coast farmer
node.description: A West Coast farming family is happy to 'lock up' some land for posterity and the birds, but they sympathise with other farmers who are upset at the prospect of having parts of their land labelled…

node.title: Black juror in Smollett trial confused why actor kept noose around his neck
node.description: "As an African American person, I'm not putting that noose back on at all," juror Andre Hope said.

node.title: That Viral Harry Styles Cardigan Just Got Auctioned as an NFT
node.description: Jonathan Anderson, the designer who made the original sweater, explains how it happened and what's next.

node.title: The U.S. health secretary hints that more federal funds may be needed to fight an Omicron surge.
node.description: With the pandemic heading into its third year, much of the money that Congress has allocated for coronavirus response has been spent.

node.title: Britain drops southern African nations from its ‘red list’ for quarantine restrictions.
node.description: With the Omicron variant already spreading, officials conclude they’ve lost the battle to prevent its entering Britain.

node.title: Researchers Develop Lyme Disease Vaccine That Targets Tick Saliva, Prevents Feeding
node.description: Yale University researchers have developed an mRNA vaccine that provides partial protection against Lyme disease.

node.title: NT tourism operators brand vaccination rules the 'worst Christmas present' as businesses try to stay afloat
node.description: Tourism chiefs want the Northern Territory government to ease strict rules for visitors and residents, which they say will ruin Christmas for struggling tour operators and others in the industry.

node.title: Passengers on two Queensland flights told to quarantine for Christmas after positive COVID case
node.description: People who flew from Brisbane to Townsville and from Newcastle to Brisbane, the first since Queensland's border reopened, are deemed close contacts and will spend Christmas in quarantine.

node.title: Hundreds of people told to isolate after Omicron exposure at Melbourne bars
node.description: Health officials confirm a person with the Omicron variant attended venues in Fitzroy and Collingwood on Friday night, potentially exposing hundreds of people to the virus.

node.title: Vicente Fernández Knew His Way Around Your Broken Heart
node.description: First breakups. Final goodbyes. For generations, Mr. Fernández, who died on Sunday, provided a soundtrack for moments of anguish and heartache, and a pathway to healing.

node.title: Tunisia’s President Promises Vote on Constitution and Sets Election Date
node.description: President Kais Saied’s announcement dispelled some of the uncertainty Tunisians have endured for months since he shunted aside Parliament in what critics called a soft coup.

node.title: European Union Proposes Overhaul of Border Rules, Extending Time to Process Asylum Claims
node.description: COVID concerns and other security concerns led to the proposed changes to current rules for the transport of people and goods across EU borders announced today.

node.title: Miss America Doubles Top Scholarship Prize, Moves to Streaming for 100th Anniversary
node.description: A total of $435,000 in scholarship money will be awarded in this year's competition, according to the nonprofit organization, with $100,000 to the winner.

node.title: Andrew Cuomo Ordered by Ethics Committee to Hand Over $5M in Book Profits to Letitia James
node.description: In an 11-2 vote, the Joint Commission on Public Ethics (JCOPE) passed a resolution requiring Cuomo to repay the sales profits he earned from his 2020 book.

node.title: Huge COVID Outbreak at Cornell Main Campus Prompts Virtual Finals, Graduation Cancellation
node.description: After the college detected over 400 positive coronavirus cases and its first Omicron case, the school shut down its main campus.

node.title: Significant changes to Finke Desert Race introduced following spectator death
node.description: Permanent changes to entry requirements will herald the end of the NT race's reputation as a unique challenge where rookies can ride alongside some of the biggest names in motorsport.

node.title: Lukas Orda's family still in limbo after vet lost with livestock ship at sea
node.description: A year after he went missing, Lukas Orda's parents are no closer to finding out what happened to their son while government communication failures mean they have not been able to move on with their lives.

node.title: 'Crying happy tears': Secret Santa pays off lay-by for shoppers at Queensland toy store
node.description: Christmas has come early for shoppers at a Townsville toy store, after a generous anonymous donor paid off their lay-by balances early in act of charity for families doing it tough.

node.title: Australia win legal battle against India over sugar subsidies
node.description: After three years, the World Trade Organization has finally reached a ruling on Australia's complaint against India's sugar subsidies.

node.title: Schmidt to join All Blacks before next year's Rugby Championship
node.description: Former Ireland coach Joe Schmidt will join the All Blacks as a selector.

node.title: O.J. Simpson a "completely free man" after parole ends
node.description: The 74-year-old former football star and actor, acquitted California murder defendant and convicted Las Vegas armed robber was granted good behavior credits.

node.title: Nearly 800,000 Americans have died of COVID. Vaccines could have saved 163,000.
node.description: The Kaiser Family Foundation estimated COVID-19's avoidable toll since June, when vaccines became widely available.

node.title: A closer look at the Mediterranean diet
node.description: The Mediterranean diet has been recommended as a heart-healthy diet by doctors and dietitians alike, but what's it really all about?

node.title: Tiny Love Stories: ‘A Child I’ll Never Meet’
node.description: Modern Love in miniature, featuring reader-submitted stories of no more than 100 words.

node.title: Wirecutter Union reaches a deal with The New York Times Company.
node.description: The contract, which the union’s members will vote on, includes immediate average wage increases of about $5,000 and 3 percent raises for each year of the deal, which runs through February 2024.

node.title: All EU Countries Must Recognize Same-Sex Parents and Their Children, Top Court Says
node.description: The European Court of Justice ruled in favor of a Bulgarian-British couple whose adopted child could not obtain citizenship.

node.title: United Arab Emirates Halts Discussion on $23B Purchase of Planes, Drones from U.S.
node.description: The UAE Embassy told the U.S. it wanted to suspend talks on a weapons sale deal due to the U.S.'s restrictions on how and when to use its F-35 planes.

node.title: TikToker Leaves 'Surprises' for 'Creepy Manager' Giving Tours of Her Apartment in Viral Clip
node.description: The TikToker left out a recipe for a "revenge spell" for her apartment manager who she says sets up viewings without permission.
